image.altText: The exterior of a restaurant with a sign reading "Zaab".

props.synopsis: The woman, now aged 54, told the Supreme Court the stairs were poorly lit and alleged the restaurant was negligent by failing to repair the uneven surface.

title.children: Woman awarded $284K in damages after falling at Braddon restaurant

image.altText: Paul laughs while sitting in a chair, wearing a blue shirt, glasses and lanyard hanging around his neck.

props.synopsis: The head of orthopaedic surgery at Canberrra Hospital resigns, along with several other surgeons, citing concerns over operational decisions being made by Canberra Health Services.

title.children: Canberra orthopaedic surgeons resign citing operational concerns

image.altText: An artists' impression of the war memorial showing a fighter jet in a large exhibition space.

props.synopsis: Will a massive expansion of the Australian War Memorial allow it to evolve or destroy what makes it special?

title.children: 'Disneyland of war': The war memorial's divisive transformation

image.altText: a boater looking out the window at sea

props.synopsis: The 34-year-old's body was found south of Eden after a three-day search by emergency services.

title.children: Body of missing Canberra rock fisher found on NSW far south coast

image.altText: Police tape and a car on the side of the road near a shop on the highway in Bungendore.

props.synopsis: Police arrest a man who allegedly stole a patrol car and punched an officer in the head in Bungendore, just outside Canberra, on Friday.

title.children: Police arrest man who allegedly stole patrol car and punched officer

image.altText: A woman wearing a pink and orange singlet and shiny sunglasses running.

props.synopsis: Around 200 people have turned out in Canberra's south to take part in a solidarity run, after a female runner was allegedly grabbed by a man at Tuggeranong Hill last weekend.

title.children: 'She's not alone': Runners gather in solidarity after woman allegedly grabbed by man

image.altText: Woman with cup in hand sits on couch with laptop on lap at home

props.synopsis: Suddenly, working from home is being debated in Canberra. But who benefits if it becomes an election issue?

title.children: Working from home is popular, as an election issue it could backfire

image.altText: Aerial view of a man rowing a giant pumpkin down a river.

props.synopsis: Rowing a giant pumpkin might seem like something from a nursery rhyme, but growing it? Mark Peacock is The Big Pumpkin grower and says it's less of a fairytale and more like a lesson in resilience.

title.children: How to grow a pumpkin big enough to row down a river

image.altText: Donald Trump points at reporters through a doorway on Air Force One

props.synopsis: There is a real possibility the world's biggest economy is heading toward a recession and it is threatening to drag the world's biggest share market into a crash.

title.children: Is Trump's plan to 'make America great again' about to push it into recession?

image.altText: Penny Wong  on Terrorgram sanctions

props.synopsis: The foreign minister has responded after the Russian ambassador said there would be "grave consequences" for Australia if it joined a peacekeeping presence in Ukraine.

title.children: Australia 'won't be intimidated' by Russian warning on Ukraine, Wong says

image.altText: a sign that reads closed until further notice stay safe hangs outside a shop in lismore as the town prepares for cyclone alfred

props.synopsis: In addition to the human cost, the financial cost of ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred is rising across the economy.

title.children: The economic cost of ex-Cyclone Alfred could be $1 billion a day

image.altText: Blue sign 'welcome to pine street' on floor

props.synopsis: The squatters, thrust into the spotlight after ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred, say they will "work as a team" to resist any attempt of eviction in north Lismore.

title.children: NSW premier accused of declaring war on Lismore squatters

image.altText: A woman makes moonshine in Bihar, India.

props.synopsis: A ban on alcohol created to protect women from domestic violence in India's Bihar has bred a criminal underworld.

title.children: A state with 130 million people banned booze. It unleashed chaos

image.altText: A police car waits in the driveway of a suburban large property

props.synopsis: Police say organised crime groups are responsible for the explosives-laden caravan discovered in January at Dural in Sydney's north-west.

title.children: Dural caravan plot was 'fake terrorism', police say. Here's what we know

image.altText: Donald Trump and Malcolm Turnbull shake hands.

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull clashes with the ABC as he warns Australia cannot self-censor "for fear of offending the huge ego of Donald Trump", and suggests Anthony Albanese will not be to blame if his government fails to secure tariff exemptions.

title.children: In tetchy ABC interview, Turnbull says Australia cannot self-censor to please Trump

image.altText: Drone image of Wharton Beach, where the shark attack took place.

props.synopsis: Authorities have resumed the search for the body of Melbourne surfer after a fatal shark attack at a remote WA beach on Monday.

title.children: Family of surfer missing after shark attack doesn't expect he will be found

image.altText: Flames and smoke rise after a cargo ship struck an oil tanker off the north-eastern coast of England.

props.synopsis: Authorities say 36 people were brought to shore after the incident off the north-eastern coast of England.

title.children: Tanker hired by US military ablaze off UK coast after strike by container ship

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Head and shoulder shot of Mike Nahan

props.synopsis: Former WA Liberal leader Mike Nahan blasts his colleagues for failing to provide a "coherent alternative" ahead of the party's latest election rout, saying upper house MPs did not do enough to engage with the community.

title.children: 'Didn't get off their bums': Liberal blame game begins after WA election

image.altText: A man looks on during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Dylan Brown's move to Newcastle in the biggest deal in rugby league history is the gamble of a lifetime for the Knights as they stake the better part of a generation on the Parramatta five-eighth.

title.children: With the richest deal in rugby league history, Newcastle are betting a generation on Dylan Brown

image.altText: Headshot of a young man in sunglasses and a pale blue hoodie against a cloudy blue sky

props.synopsis: A former Perth childcare worker who sexually assaulted a three-year-old girl in his care could be eligible for parole after seven and a half months in prison.

title.children: Perth childcare worker jailed for sexually assaulting three-year-old

image.altText: Lino Atem wears a basketball top and looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Nine teenagers are among those arrested after 24-year-old Lino Atem was killed in what police allege was a "ferocious" and "targeted" ambush at a park in Melbourne's south-west.

title.children: Police arrest 13 people over stabbing death of Lino Atem

image.altText: A large lightning bolt strikes Portland

props.synopsis: The 36-year-old woman was taken to Millicent hospital with non-life-threatening injuries during a severe thunderstorm, which also sparked close to 100 fires and left thousands without power.

title.children: Woman struck by lightning in SA's South East during severe thunderstorms

image.altText: Ipswich flooding

props.synopsis: Queensland has made a "step towards recovery", with all emergency alerts now cancelled as rainfall eases and rivers recede, the state's premier says.

title.children: 'Step towards recovery': All emergency alerts cancelled in Queensland

image.altText: Man with floodwaters up to his shins stands with dog in backyard

props.synopsis: Working out how to claim insurance is confusing at the best of times. Here's how to claim, and the steps to take to make the insurance process easier.

title.children: The evidence you need to make an insurance claim after flooding

image.altText: Professor Richard Scolyer

props.synopsis: Former Australian of the Year Richard Scolyer says he is heartbroken to reveal his brain cancer has returned after revolutionary treatment kept the aggressive tumour at bay for more than 18 months.

title.children: 'I'm not ready to die': Professor Richard Scolyer's heartbreaking prognosis

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy gestures as he talks to media

props.synopsis: Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with the Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman in Jeddah, as the Middle East nation tries to assert itself as a peace maker between Ukraine and Russia.

title.children: Zelenskyy arrives in Saudi Arabia ahead of Ukraine peace talks

image.altText: Patrick Dangerfield of the Cats leads his team out onto the field.

props.synopsis: Multiple AFL clubs will face scheduled audits in 2025, as veteran journalist Caroline Wilson reported the league is looking into third party payments at Geelong Football Club.

title.children: 'You don’t want to mess with the salary cap': Clubs audited by AFL

image.altText: An intricate golden star shape above capital letters that spell out "The Star" advertising a casino.

props.synopsis: Against all odds, Star Entertainment has managed to avoid sliding into administration for now. But its near demise poses bigger problems for a glittering world that risks being consigned to a bygone era.

title.children: A former pro poker player, Star's CEO has pulled off a stone-cold bluff

image.altText: Supporters of impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol wave US and South Korean flags.

props.synopsis: Wearing symbolic white helmets and waving "Stop the Steal" flags, the young men of the "white skull squad" are back on the streets of South Korea and wanting the US to intervene in their country's democracy.

title.children: Young men are fuelling the rise of the 'White Skull Squad' in Korea

image.altText: A man wearing a black shirt with a white logo that says "DOGE" shows it off to the camera smiling

props.synopsis: The owner of X has announced the incident on his own platform after users around the world reported issues on the site.

title.children: Elon Musk says X outages due to 'massive cyberattack'

image.altText: A young, fair-haired man with a neat beard lies in bed. His nose is swollen and his face is bruised.

props.synopsis: A solicitor who was bashed in his home town says he was thinking "this could be it" as he was kicked and punched by a gang of young men.

title.children: Young lawyer haunted by savage bashing in Bendigo

image.altText: A group of men in uniforms sit in the back of a truck, some on their phones, others talking.

props.synopsis: Fiji Rugby's chairman is demanding the "full facts" surrounding the Fijian Drua's mistreatment while in New Zealand, where they were forced to travel in the back of a cargo truck in Auckland.

title.children: 'Unacceptable': Fiji Rugby demands answers following Drua's mistreatment in NZ

image.altText: A night scene of a tree branch fallen on the ground, with lights strung up behind

props.synopsis: Two people were injured — and one was taken to hospital — when a tree branch fell in Botanic Park during the WOMADelaide festival on Monday. Emergency services are urging people to take care near heat stressed trees after a hot summer.

title.children: Two injured in 'awful, tragic' tree branch fall during WOMADelaide

image.altText: A woman outstretched her hands while singing into a microphone stand. A stage light illuminates her from below.

props.synopsis: You might come to WOMADelaide for the headliners, but you'll leave with a new favourite band.

title.children: Forget your favourites — WOMADelaide's best moments come from new discoveries
